description: CSS scroll snap controls the panning and scrolling behavior within a scroll container.
description_html: CSS scroll snap controls the panning and scrolling behavior within a scroll container.
name: Scroll snap

firefox.notes: The scroll-margin property can cause an element's visibility to be incorrectly calculated for element.focus(). See bug 1708303.

firefox_android.notes: The scroll-margin property can cause an element's visibility to be incorrectly calculated for element.focus(). See bug 1708303.

safari.notes: Before version 14.1, scroll margin is not applied for scrolls to fragment target or scrollIntoView(), see bug 189265.

safari_ios.notes: Before version 14.5, scroll margin is not applied for scrolls to fragment target or scrollIntoView(), see bug 189265.

edge.notes: Edge supports an earlier draft of CSS Scroll Snap without axis values.

firefox.notes: On macOS Monterey, scroll snapping does not complete reliably. See bug 1749352.
An earlier draft of CSS Scroll Snap without axis values.

firefox_android.notes: An earlier draft of CSS Scroll Snap without axis values.

ie.notes: Internet Explorer supports an earlier draft of CSS Scroll Snap without axis values.

safari.notes: Older Safari versions support an earlier draft of CSS Scroll Snap without axis values.

safari_ios.notes: Older Safari on iOS versions support an earlier draft of CSS Scroll Snap without axis values.

webview_ios.notes: Older WebView on iOS versions support an earlier draft of CSS Scroll Snap without axis values.
